snippet: Israel sees the enforcement of President Obama’s “red line” as essential to halting Iran’s nuclear ambitions, and seems to prefer an attack that would maintain the status quo without strengthening either side.
abstract: Israel sees the enforcement of President Obama’s 'red line' position on Syria as essential to halting Iran’s nuclear ambitions, and seems to prefer an attack that would maintain the status quo without strengthening either side; synergy between Israeli and American positions, while not explicitly articulated by leaders of either country, could be critical source of support as Obama seeks Congressional approval for strikes in Syria.
lead_paragraph: Israel sees the enforcement of President Obama’s “red line” as essential to halting Iran’s nuclear ambitions, and seems to prefer an attack that would maintain the status quo without strengthening either side.

headline.main: Israel Backs Limited Strike Against Syria
headline.print_headline: Israel Backs Limited Strike Against Syria
